title: Is Trolling In Normal Games OK?
body:
i have seen a lot of people intentionaly feed in their normal games and i myself have done it too,everyone talks about toxicity being leagues only problem but what about trolls? how can you expect a player to not flame when you put him in a situation where he can be griefed by another player for AT LEAST 20 minutes?
I persoanly remain calm at all times,i tolerate players who play badly,everyone has bad games.
i tolerate players who flame,maybe he is on a lose streak
but i cant find any space in my heart for trolls,and how could i?
how can i respect someone who finds joy in making everyone sad?
this isnt a rant,or a saltfull thread,just a reminder to riot that flaming isnt league's ONLY problem.

replies.body: Never, if you want to waste your time then int feed bots in custom but don't waste 9 other people's time

Trolling isn't ok. If you don't have a legitmately reason for doing something other than to purposely handicap your team, there's a problem.

Support tryndamere isn't an issue if you're picking it for a legitmate reason like wanting to see if it did work, or to push the lane harder or something.
classic NA,if its not a meme its getting downvoted

Most "trolling" is some baby having a bad day and blaming a team meber who is doing something slightly different.

Trolling is only bad if it falls into intentionally feeding, spam, harassment or intentionally angering other players.

trolling is absolutely fine in normal !!!

I meant it all about experimenting

*does this work on lux?
*does this work on yasuo?
*does this work on the shity nidalee now?
*does doing work

many question!!!!

Depends on your definition of trolling.

Running it down mid is stupid and reportable.

But something like ADC LeBlanc is harmless and shouldn't be stressed.
my definition of trolling,like i mentioned in the post, is intentionaly feeding,whether that is a 0/12 leblanc adc or a draven running it down mid does not concern me.
